intro: Viola effusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of violet, blue, or white, usually blooming from late spring to early summer. Viola effusa prefers moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its flowers are pollinated by bees and other insects, and it is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
